Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: parts of two black-figure friezes with single band between: above, parts of two padded dancers to left; on left, bearded figure (top of head missing) with both arms extended low to left, left leg kicked back, with added red on garment; at right, figure mostly lost (trace of belly with red on garment and legs with left knee bent remaining); incised splinter rosette as filling ornament; in lower frieze, animals (possibly top part of goat’s horn; panther's head, to left with red on neck); incised splinter rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Louvre E624 in Payne 1931, 329 no. 1458.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.35)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 329 , no. 1458)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.040) (Phase 1)
